intro: Potentilla tytthantha, commonly known as the alpine potentilla, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapted to withstand cold and harsh environmental conditions. Potentilla tytthantha is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
